com.nutiteq.components
Class Color

java.lang.Object
  com.nutiteq.components.Color

public class Color
extends java.lang.Object

Color, represented in RGB space, with additional alpha component.

Constructor Detail

Color

public Color(int color)
Default constructor.

Parameters:
color - color encoded in 32-bits as ARGB.

Color

public Color(int r,
             int g,
             int b)
Construct color from red, green and blue components.

Parameters:
r - red component of the color. Must be between 0 and 255.
g - green component of the color. Must be between 0 and 255.
b - blue component of the color. Must be between 0 and 255.

Color

public Color(int r,
             int g,
             int b,
             int a)
Construct color from red, green and blue and alpha components. Note: alpha is interpreted as non-premultiplied transparency value, thus to make half-transparent green, use argb(128, 0, 255, 0).

Parameters:
r - red component of the color. Must be between 0 and 255.
g - green component of the color. Must be between 0 and 255.
b - blue component of the color. Must be between 0 and 255.
a - alpha component of the color. Must be between 0 and 255.
Method Detail

argb

public static int argb(int a,
                       int r,
                       int g,
                       int b)
Calculate color value from ARGB (Alpha, Red, Green, Blue) components. Note: alpha is interpreted as non-premultiplied transparency value, thus to make half-transparent green, use argb(128, 0, 255, 0).

Parameters:
a - alpha component (0..255)
r - red component (0..255)
g - green component (0..255)
b - blue component (0..255)
Returns:
color value
